definition: the cooked duck flew away (proverb)/(fig.) to let a sure thing slip through one's fingers
pinyin: zhu3 shu2 de5 ya1 zi5 fei1 le5

sentences.english: The fish is so fresh, it is like a fish jumped on the table and cooked itself.
sentences.chinese: 活像是鱼自己跳上桌面瞬间煮熟般鲜美。

sentences.english: American Chinese food tends to be cooked very quickly with a great deal of oil and salt.
sentences.chinese: 美国中餐往往是非常快煮熟了大量油和盐。

sentences.english: Put it into the pan with potatoes – boiled and mashed.
sentences.chinese: 将它倒入装有煮熟捣碎的土豆的平底锅内。

sentences.english: People can also become infected by consuming undercooked meat.
sentences.chinese: 人们同样可以经由食用未煮熟的肉类而感染。

sentences.english: Wash all fruit and vegetable thoroughly before eating.
sentences.chinese: 清洗所有的水果和蔬菜彻底煮熟才进食。

sentences.english: One cooked cupful can provide as much as 17 g fiber.
sentences.chinese: 一满杯煮熟的豆子可以提供高达17克纤维。

sentences.english: Can Egg Products Be Used As An Ingredient In Uncooked Foods?
sentences.chinese: 蛋制品能作为未煮熟食品中的一种成分吗？

sentences.english: The rice reportedly stays hard even after being cooked.
sentences.chinese: 合成的假米即使煮熟后也保持一定硬度。

sentences.english: "What an excellent fish dolphin is to eat cooked, " he said.
sentences.chinese: “鲯鳅煮熟了吃味道多鲜美啊，”他说。

sentences.english: My steak is undercooked. I ordered it well-done.
sentences.chinese: 这牛排没煮熟，我点的是全熟的。

sentences.english: Cooked well done unless otherwise specified.
sentences.chinese: 煮熟的做得好除非另外说明。

sentences.english: Boil the ham until it is done.
Slices that are as thin as paper can easily be cooked in the boiling water.
sentences.chinese: 像纸一样薄的肉片在开水里很容易煮熟。

sentences.english: It's also tempting to place the cooked grub back onto the plate that held your raw meat.
sentences.chinese: 同样人们容易把煮熟的食物放回盛有生肉的盘子。

sentences.english: After peeling them, she got the eggs, cooked and hard.
sentences.chinese: 剥皮之后，女儿得到的是煮熟的鸡蛋，硬硬的。

definition: to peel/to remove the skin/to tare
quick-boil/to boil for a short time
